subject: Creativity
title: Does Imagination Decline with Age?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Does Imagination Decline with Age?.

hook.text: Common belief: children are imaginative, adults are practical, and seniors lose creativity.

buildup.text: Divergent thinking peaks in childhood and declines into adulthood.

discovery.text: Older adults show equal or superior creative problem-solving because they draw on decades of accumulated knowledge.

twist.text: Many great works were created after 60: Verdi composed Falstaff at 80, Hokusai created iconic works past 70, Frank.

climax.text: What declines isn't imagination itself â€” it's the willingness to use it.

punchline.text: Imagination doesn't expire. It just gets too polite.
